newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft CFO sees Q3 EPS of $0.63-$0.66.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft CFO sees Q3 EPS of $0.63-$0.66.

text.p: Microsoft Corp Chief Financial Officer Mike Brown said he expects to see the company's earnings in the current fiscal third quarter to rise sequentially "more than a nickel, less than a dime."

Brown's prediction in a conference call with analysts and reporters would put third-quarter net income at between $0.63 and $0.66 a share, compared with $0.44 a year earlier and $0.57 in the just-ended second quarter.
Brown predicted EPS would rise "a penny or so" in the fourth quarter from the third quarter.
While Brown said he was optimistic about the rest of fiscal 1997 ending June 30, he reiterated that the company expects to see growth slow in fiscal 1998.
And he said that given the slowing year-on-year revenue growth of 27 percent on a trailing 12 months basis, Microsoft's price-to-earnings ratio of 46 is "a cause for curiosity at least to me."

He said the company will continue to buy back shares for its employee stock option program, but planned to be cautious "until it is clear the market has realistically digested our fiscal 1998 growth potential."
